questions.question: At which point in a vertical circle is the tension (or normal force) usually at its maximum?
questions.explanation: At bottom, tension must support weight AND provide centripetal force: $T = mg + mv^2/r$.

questions.question: At the TOP of a vertical loop, in which direction do the weight and the tension act?
options: Weight acts down, tension acts up.
Weight acts up, tension acts down.
Both act downward toward the center.
Both act upward away from the center.
questions.explanation: At top, both weight and tension point downward toward center: $F_c = T + mg$.

questions.question: For an object to complete a full vertical circle (loop), what condition must be met?
options: The speed at the bottom must be zero.
The tension at the top must be at least zero.
The weight must be greater than the centripetal force at the top.
The speed at the top must be exactly $9.8 \text{ m/s}$.
questions.explanation: At top, minimum speed occurs when tension just becomes zero. Tension cannot be negative.

questions.question: According to energy conservation, if an object moves from the bottom of a circle to the top, its kinetic energy:
questions.explanation: Height increases, so potential energy increases and kinetic energy decreases.

questions.question: A 1 kg mass is whirled in a vertical circle of radius 0.4 m. What is the minimum speed required at the TOP to keep the string taut? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
If the minimum speed at the top of a 2.5 m radius loop is 5 m/s, what is the minimum speed required at the BOTTOM to complete the circle? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A 2 kg object at the bottom of a 2 m radius circle moves at 10 m/s. What is the tension in the string? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
An object has a speed of 6 m/s at the top of a vertical circle where the radius is 1.2 m. If the mass is 0.5 kg, what is the tension at the top? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

A bucket of water is swung in a vertical circle of radius 1.6 m. What is the maximum period ($T$) allowed at the top to ensure the water stays in the bucket? (Use $\pi^2 \approx 10$, $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A string breaks if the tension exceeds 100 N. If a 2 kg mass is whirled in a 1 m radius vertical circle, what is the maximum speed it can have at the BOTTOM? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on $T \pm mg = mv^2/r$ and energy conservation.
